attributes.action: Consider the amendments on Matrimonial Causes Act 1973, “Akther v Khan 2020“
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to understand the consequences of the judgement on the case of “Akther v Khan 2020”, which makes a Muslim married women leave without a hope of support due to conditions of the Matrimonial law. House of Parliament has a duty to consider the reasonable amendments on to the law of Matrimonial Causes Act 1973, which will help families in a similar situation as “Akther v Khan”

Recommendation legislative change 
“Matrimonial Causes Act 1973“
Reference: Judgement ”Akther v Khan 2020”
attributes.background: Critical impact of the judgment in the case of, “Akther v Khan 2020“ on the right of a married Muslim women and Matrimonial law. It should be carefully consider the reasonable amendments to the Matrimonial law regards to the beneficial interests of a women who wish to marry under the (Sharia law)

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand you'd like to see changes to the Matrimonial Causes Act 1973, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to change. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
